alert.note: Alert for Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 5:06AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM EXPECTED TO IMPACT THE SUSITNA VALLEY MONDAY... Snow is expected to develop Monday morning across much of the Susitna Valley. The snow is expected to start off as wet snow before transitioning to a drier, more powdery snow by Monday afternoon or evening. Snowfall rates are also expected to increase late Monday, especially along the Parks Highway from Talkeetna south to Willow, as a colder northwesterly flow develops. Snowfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches with isolated amounts up to 5 inches are possible. The highest amounts are expected along the Parks Highway from Talkeetna south to Willow. Slow down and use caution when traveling through these areas for the morning and especially the evening commute Monday. For the latest informations go to www.weather.gov/anchorage
